IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PRESERVE AND TEACH THE HISTORY OF MAINE
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MAINE HISTORICAL SOCIETY PRESERVES THE HERITAGE AND HISTORY OF MAINE: THE STORIES OF MAINE PEOPLE, THE TRADITIONS OF MAINE COMMUNITIES, AND THE RECORD OF MAINE'S PLACE IN A CHANGING WORLD. BECAUSE AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE PAST IS VITAL TO A HEALTHY AND PROGRESSIVE SOCIETY, WE COLLECT, CARE FOR, AND EXHIBIT HISTORICAL TREASURES; FACILITATE RESEARCH INTO FAMILY, LOCAL, STATE AND NATIONAL HISTORY; PROVIDE EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT MAKE HISTORY MEANINGFUL, ACCESSIBLE AND ENJOYABLE; AND EMPOWER OTHERS TO PRESERVE AND INTERPRET THE HISTORY OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND OUR STATE.
IRS990.Description: OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF HISTORICAL RESEARCH LIBRARY5,178 ON-SITE VISITORSTHE MAINE HISTORICAL SOCIETY WEB SITE IS PART OF ALL MAJOR PROGRAMS.547,782 UNIQUE WEB SITE VISITORS FOR YEAR OVER ALL PROGRAMS.

Activity2.Description: OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE WADSWORTH LONGFELLOW HOUSE (A HISTORIC STRUCTURE) AND MUSEUM11,487 ON-SITE VISITORS

ActivityOther.Description: REMAINING PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE MUSEUM GIFT SHOP, MEMBERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, AND DIGITAL SERVICES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Collections: The collections, which were acquired through purchases and contributions since the Society's inception, are not recognized as assets on the statement of financial position. Purchases of collection items are recorded as decreases in unrestricted net assets in the year in which the items are acquired, or as temporarily or permanently restricted net assets if the assets used to purchase the items are restricted by donors. Contributed collection items are not reflected on the financial statements. Proceeds from deaccessions are reflected as increases in the appropriate net asset classes.
Recognition of unrealized gains on investments - Unrestricted: 118820. recognition of unrealized gains on investments - TR: 0. recognition of unrealized gains on investments - PR: 0.
RENTAL INCOME (NET RENTAL INCOME INCLUDED ONLY): 47320.
RENTAL EXPENSES REPORTED ON PAGE 9, LINE 6b: 47320.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE SOCIETY USES A BROKERAGE SERVICE TO RECEIVE AND LIQUIDATE ANY STOCK GIFTS RECEIVED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SOCIETY OFFERS MEMBERSHIPS, FOR AN ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP FEE, TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHICH COME WITH CERTAIN BENEFITS AND RIGHTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ACCORDING TO THE SOCIETY BYLAWS, THE PROCESS FOR ELECTING TRUSTEES TO THE BOARD CALLS FOR MAILING AN ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE SLATE OF CANDIDATES TO THE MEMBERS PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL MEETING. AN OFFICIAL BALLOT IS ALSO MAILED IN ADVANCE OF THE MEETING. ADDITIONAL CANDIDATES MAY BE INCLUDED ON THE OFFICAL BALLOT BY PETITIONING THE TRUSTEE COMMITTEE. PETITIONS SHOULD BE SIGNED BY NO FEWER THAN TWENTY MEMBERS. NO NOMINATIONS ARE ENTERTAINED FROM THE FLOOR OF THE ANNUAL MEETING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES IN THE PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
